required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Measure Food and Calorie Consumption in Very Overweight Participants Using Tirzepatide
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Placebo-Controlled, Parallel-Arm Study to Investigate the Effect of Once-Weekly Tirzepatide on Energy Expenditure and Food Intake in Obese Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: This is a study of tirzepatide in very overweight participants. The main purpose is to learn more about how tirzepatide affects the number of calories participants burn and the amount of food they eat. The study will last 28 weeks and will include about 21 visits to the study center.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in Sleep Metabolic Rate (SMR)
primary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in SMR

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in Food Intake During Ad Libitum Meal
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in Food Intake During Ad Libitum Meal

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in 24-hour Energy Expenditure (EE)
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in 24-hour EE

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in 24 Hour Respiratory Quotient
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in 24 Hour Respiratory Quotient

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in Percentage of Body Fat Mass
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in Percentage of Body Fat Mass

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in Free Fatty Acids
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 18 during standardized mixed meal tolerance test
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in Free Fatty Acids

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in Fasting Insulin Resistance
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 18 during standardized mixed meal tolerance test
secondary_outcome.description: Fasting insulin resistance measured using the Homeostatic Model of Assessment method

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in Postmeal Glucose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, Week 18 during standardized mixed meal tolerance test
secondary_outcome.description: Change from Baseline to Week 18 in Postmeal Glucose

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Have body mass index of 30 to 45 kilograms per square meter (kg/mÂ²), inclusive
- Have a stable body weight in the past 1 month prior to screening
- Willing and agreeable to commit to the duration of the study and undergo study procedures as instructed by the clinic staff
Exclusion Criteria:
- Have undergone gastric bypass or bariatric surgery
- Have a diagnosis of type 2 diabetes
- Have a history or current cardiovascular, respiratory, hepatic, renal, gastrointestinal, endocrine, hematological or neurological disorders capable of significantly altering the absorption, metabolism or elimination of drugs; of constituting a risk when taking the study drug; or of interfering with the interpretation of data
- Have received prescription drugs or over the counter drugs that promote weight loss in the past 6 months prior to screening
- Have any lifetime history of a suicide attempt
- Patient Health Questionnaire-9 (PHQ-9) score of 15 or more at screening
- Positive responses to selected items on the Columbia Suicide Severity Rating Scale (C-SSRS)
